website_summaries.verdict: The StratoLauncher IV brings an element of science to the world of water bottle launching. Heights of over 350 feet are possible, and the unit can be attached to a computerized STEM launch system.
pros: Can be modified for multiple launches with air compressor
Accepts virtually all sizes of plastic bottles for launch
cons: Fins are more decorative than functional

customer_reviews.title: Responsive Company
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a lot to compare this launcher to since it’s the first one I’ve purchased. However, the handle to trigger the launch broke on the second launch. Fortunately, my co-teacher was able to quickly find a solution so we were still able to launch the rockets. Update: I reached out to the company directly and let them know about the problem. They were able to send a replacement part so we could continue to use the product in its intended way.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: This thing is super cool.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's not a kid's toy, but it sure was fun for all of us. I will say that taking the time to make a decent parachute or 2 will help preserve the fins. Or buy a parachute for a big estes model rocket. We made our own nose cones, out of poster board, in stead of another bottle. This made it fly straight and High. The poster board also allows the nose cone to easily separate, releasing the parachute. If you are able to find your way around a tool box, and basic home repairs, then this will be easy to put together. I didn't even read the instructions, and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: David Price

customer_reviews.title: Flat out awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This water rocket launcher blew our minds during that first launch! We couldn't believe it when we saw that rocket take off into the sky. My kids loved it. I played with a neighbors water rocket back in the 70s so this brought back memories for me. I'm handy so putting it together was a breeze. You should really find an open field for this launcher so the rocket want land on a neighbors house or car, as it goes up very high. Customer service from Relationshipware is also excellent and very responsive! Great product, great fun, and great support!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but release lever is too cheaply made, replacement parts are expensive
customer_reviews.text: Fun and amazingly high launch, but plastic replacement parts are expensive and the brake handle release mechanism is very cheaply made leading to anticlimactic moments. Find a better brake handle supplier and lower your replacement fins cost to $5-6 and this would be a winner in all categories.
customer_reviews.author: B. Reasonable

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed. Very cool. Safe and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Pair it with a cheap 12v air compressor(11$) and small 12v jump start battery(30$). You can launch rockets all day without pumping. The trick nozzle uses less water too so you only need a gallon of water to launch ~10 times with a 2L and 20+ with a 20oz. It shoots about as high as an Estes B size engine. Great reusuable entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Chance P.

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Launch platform is really good and i would have given 5 stars but the tail fins didn't last more than 2 launches and then broke
customer_reviews.author: BYK Matty

customer_reviews.title: A quality product, but requires tweaking.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions could be clearer, and more accurately reflect the product as delivered. Especially regarding sealing the threaded metal connections. They all required the Teflon tape in spite of instructions stating otherwise. Some Vaseline or other waterproof grease on lip of soda bottle will seal leakage at StratoFins, a rubber washer there would be helpful. Once all the leaks are sealed, product performs great.
customer_reviews.author: B Cook

customer_reviews.title: sweet
customer_reviews.text: works great after all, took for ever to make adjustments to the launcher release and release cable, instructions are clear as mud but other tha that it works great
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe Foilhat

customer_reviews.title: Missing half of the pieces
customer_reviews.text: Came missing the tilting ball head, pressure gauge and hose Q- release. Not helpful when doing a homework project over the weekend and all of the pieces are missing!
customer_reviews.author: Monroe85

customer_reviews.title: Great Science Lessons
customer_reviews.text: Achieves advertised height when pumped to 125psi. Use a large bicycle pump to achieve 125psi. Ours exceeded 50ft at 80psi.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel-Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: Great product and hours of fun. Me and my kids will get the portable compressor and a jug of water and have a blast for hours
customer_reviews.author: kdubbs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best gift i've bought online, STEM program use, green, clean, awesome. Get a good pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, my grandkids love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works better that I had expected. My grandkids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like a rocket....
customer_reviews.text: This is very cool. I bought it for my son. It shoots very high, nearly out of sight, quickly, hissing as it goes! Very exciting. I bought it for my son and I am impressed, too.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Tension Cable Mechanism Jammed after light use
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price. I only got 2 30 minute sessions out of this. The tension cable used to pull the release mechanism jammed inside the cable jacket. I couldn't even move it with pliers let alone the cheap plastic lever supplied, which broke in half. The entire mechanism is now basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina D. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Impressive results
customer_reviews.text: This kit is perfect. Exceeded my expectations and produces pretty amazing results. I bought to entertain my toddler but this kit ended up entertaining me more.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This thing has been great, or the stand anyways
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great, or the stand anyways. The plastic fins broke, but realistically that was my fault as it flew through some trees, multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Backus

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This better made than expected and went incredibly high. Very glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: RdStrcklnd

customer_reviews.title: Great launcher.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic launcher. Fins broke 2nd time out but it broke during a crash so no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great fun, but fins broke after 10 times
customer_reviews.text: Great fun, but fins broke after 10 times. The assembly is easy but will require you to have a couple of different sizes of socket screws and Philips screws.
customer_reviews.author: R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful "toy" for kids
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for our grandchildren. Buy extra fins. A broken fin ended a day of fun.
customer_reviews.author: tom morris

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome launcher! It came right on time, and my nephews are absolutely loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Stice

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, be sure to add extra tape to the connections however!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great science fair project
customer_reviews.text: Might need an adult to build. Fun project for the science fair and the kids loved it.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids and I!
customer_reviews.text: A great amount of fun. The kids had fun launching it and then chasing it down. All you need is a 2 liter bottle and a second to create a cone for the top. I have launched it at least 25 times before winter. It is a little difficult to aim this version. You have to prop it accordingly. They make versions that tilt. DONT FORGET TO SCREW IN THE LONG SKINNY PIECE! The instructions were no very specific.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Vogels

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but upgrade to the metal quick connect. My plastic one cross threaded.
customer_reviews.author: Thornton Hughes

customer_reviews.title: ... don't help at all foe launching straight but it's funny to use
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this wings don't help at all foe launching straight but it's funny to use .
customer_reviews.author: daniel mckee

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3rd use
customer_reviews.text: A fin broke after the 3rd launch when it landed on soft soil. My son was devastated as he had waited a couple weeks for this product as a reward he had earned. The first 3 launches were awesome. Not so much fun now.
customer_reviews.author: JenO

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Quality is really good and built well. Assembly is relatively easy, you do need to use some degree of "know-how" to get it together as the instructions do not spell out every detail as some may need. My sons love it and it shoots a 1L bottle nice and high, just as advertised. A great gift for an aspiring rocketeer....
customer_reviews.author: gitmomike

product_meta.title: Relationshipware StratoLauncher IV Water Rocket Launcher + StratoFins
product_meta.description: Our StratoLauncher IV kit includes a water rocket launcher made of aluminum, stainless steel, durable plastic, & brass parts, a set of StratoFins & collapsible water fill funnel. Assembly is quick & easy with no further adjustments required regardless if you use our StratoFins or your own homemade rocket or FTC (Fluorescent Tube Cover) rocket thanks to the screw-on nozzle. Employing a nozzle makes this a universal launcher for most any style water rocket and eliminates problems such as bottles not fitting over a launch tube, O-rings wearing out, or accidental launches due to falling collars. The restricted nozzle facilitates lift offs that are 3 – 6 times slower (depending on PSI) than typical water rocket launchers enabling you to see the blast off and yet the nozzle rocket will fly equal to or higher in altitude. Also, the nozzle requires only 1 cup of water per launch for optimum performance although you are free to experiment. StratoLauncher IV ships unassembled with a QR code on the box label that you can scan with your smartphone to view a PDF containing assembly instructions, launch procedures, upgrade kits, videos, and future accessories. NO additional materials are required for assembly, but you will need an adjustable wrench (or a 14mm wrench), 4 & 5mm hex wrench, & a Phillips head screwdriver. Our StratoLauncher IV will enable you to propel a 2 liter soda bottle over 350 ft. into the sky using only water and compressed air from a bicycle pump or an air compressor. Fuel (water & air) is essentially free and readily available allowing countless launches without additional expense. You control when the launch occurs by squeezing the black lever and releasing the lock at the end of the cable from a safe distance of 10 ft. and out of the splash zone. StratoLauncher IV comes in 3 models: Standard, Deluxe, and Ultimate. Any of them can be upgraded to add additional features and all come with a 125 PSI safety valve to prevent exploding bottles while pressurizing.
feature_bullets: Easy to assemble metal water rocket launcher with a 125 PSI safety valve. Rocket will NOT fly straight without an aerodynamic nose cone made from a second soda bottle and use only 1 cup (237 ml) of water.
Kit includes our Gen 4 StratoLauncher + StratoFins (screw-on water rocket fins) + fill funnel. Watch assembly video on this listing at the end of the pictures.
StratoLauncher IV will propel a 2 liter plastic (PET) soda pop bottle over 350 ft. in the sky. Watch the last minute of the assembly video for launch procedure.
Supports most .5L, 1L, 1.25L, 2L soda bottles @ air pressures as low as 15 PSI up to 120 PSI.
Kit is fully upgradeable, expandable, & can be accessorized into a complete launching system for STEM.
